greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle where T(n,k) = Product_{j=1..k} floor(n/j - 1), as read by rows n>=0, columns k=0..[n/2].
comment: Compare the definition to that of Pascal's triangle:
link: Paul D. Hanna, Rows n = 0..70, flattened
formula: Right border of even-indexed rows equals A207646.
Right border of odd-indexed rows equals A207647.
example: Triangle begins with row n=0 as:
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Product[Floor[n/j - 1], {j, 1, k}]; Flatten[Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 15}, {k, 0, Floor[n/2]}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 12 2012 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 20 2012
